sentence.Network_en: Mrs Hardie hurried to make up for her tactlessness by asking her guest about his holiday.
sentence.Network_cn: 哈迪夫人赶紧问客人假期过得怎么样，替自己的言不得体打圆场。

sentence.Network_en: His tactlessness showed that he had completely misread the situation.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不能随机应变,这表明他对情势完全误解了.

sentence.Network_en: Thinking this was because of the old woman's tactlessness, her husband just smiled.
sentence.Network_cn: 男子以为这是笑大娘不懂事,所以也在一旁干笑着.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 【笔记】friends-0108 - Fresh的日志 - 网易博客 ... tact n. 老练，机智，得体 tactlessness n. 不得体，不老练 sheepish 羞怯的.

list.abs: without tact ; in a tactless manner .没有机智；以不机智的方式。
a socially awkward or tactless act ., 一种社交方面尴尬或不老练的动作.
how I longed for the power to unsay my tactless words !我真的渴望能收回自己那无知的言语！
It was apparently tactless , and yet it was anything but tactless ., 这明明是不老练 , 但又决不是不老练.

auth_sentence.content: Through tactlessness and inertia, this appears to be happening once again.

auth_sentence.content: The new King's Scottish reign was characterised by government tactlessness and economic disasters.
